metadata.Title: CVE-2016-10542 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.Description: ws is a "simple to use, blazing fast and thoroughly tested websocket client, server and console for node.js, up-to-date against RFC-6455". By sending an overly long websocket payload to a `ws` server, it is possible to crash the node process. This affects ws 1.1.0 and earlier.

criterions.comment: node-ws package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.1.0+ds1.e6ddaae4-5').
